question: During the reign of which of the following kings, the temple of Sangamesvara at Pattadakal in Bijapur District was constructed?
explanation: King Vijayaditya who ruled the Deccan Chalukyas from A.D. 696 to 733 built the great temple of Siva under the name of Vljayesvara now called Sangamesvara at Pattadakal in Bijapur District.
